results.title: Ghosts of a river
results.creator_credit: Jacques Kasma, Pierre Patry and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: Looks at the Columbia River as a wild and untamed stream coursing through its beautiful mountain region, sparsely populated but replete with history. Many of the old shot towns and abandoned mines, destined to extinction due to plans for a giant hydro-electric scheme which would transform the whole valley, are shown.

results.title: Ghana today
results.brief_description: The epic story of the emergence of independence of the Gold Coast of Africa. Established by the Portuguese in the 15th century, Ghana became a British colony in 1874. The accent in this programme is on Prime Minister Nkrumah, political hero, and magnetic leader. Shows the industrial and social development since independence, proving that Ghana has won the right to freedom under Nkrumah.

results.title: Get wet
results.creator_credit: William Canning and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: An exciting invitation to do just what the title recommends. The film is about everyone’s capacity to enjoy water sport, be it in a pool or in the open water of lake or river. Includes some dazzling exhibitions of diving and water skiing.

results.title: Georgian background
results.creator_credit: W. Hugh Baddeley, Clement W. Bending, Educational Foundation and Gateway Film Productions
results.brief_description: Shows through dramatised scenes, museum pieces and contemporary architecture the way of life of English people in the eighteenth century. Dress, household objects, furnishings and re-enacted social occasions; travel by coach; the landscape showing the enclosure movement; the spinning jenny and the beginnings of the Industrial Revolution; examples of eighteenth century art.
results.creator_credit_for_label: W. Hugh Baddeley, Clement W. Bending, Educational Foundation and Gateway Film Productions

results.title: Georges Rouault (1871-1958)
results.creator_credit: Genevieve Nouaille Rouault, Isabelle Rouault, Pierre Courthion and Texture Films
results.brief_description: A film on the twentieth century master painter Georges Rouault, his childhood, the atelier of Gustave Moreau, the scandalous Fauves, violent social protest, the Miserere and the last glowing Biblical Landscapes.

results.title: Genetics: Mendel's law
results.brief_description: Duplicates some of Mendel’s experiments with pea plants, and explains his laws of segregation, independent assortment and dominance. Describes later work by De Vries, Correns, Morgan and Muller. Suitable for upper secondary level.

results.title: Geelong's m'name
results.creator_credit: Adrian Boddington, Geelong Harbor Trust Commissioners and Zanthus Films
results.brief_description: ‘The Geelong’ a tug boat in Corio Bay escorts cargo ships and tankers on the four hour journey along the deep but narrow channel into port. The tugs are on call day and night in the busy industrial port. All Geelong’s shipping activities are controlled by the signal station at Point Henry, site of the original settlement of Geelong. Crude oil from Persia, phosphate from Nauru, sulphur from Mexico, are among the cargoes brought to the port, while wool, wheat and meat, products from the rich Western district, are among its exports.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Adrian Boddington, Geelong Harbor Trust Commissioners and Zanthus Films

results.title: Gateway to adventure
results.creator_credit: Darcy Conyers, Anthony Gilkison and Rayant Pictures
results.brief_description: A lively impression of the variety and adventure which characterises the training of Naval Officer Cadets at the renowned Britannia Royal Naval College, Dartmouth. Includes exercises on land, at sea and in the air; mock engagement between a ship at the Dartmouth Squadron and an “enemy” submarine, and a passing-out parade, with all its attendant ceremonial, held in the presence of Admiral of the Fleet, the Earl Mountbatten of Burma.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Darcy Conyers, Anthony Gilkison and Rayant Pictures

results.title: Gateway to a city [West Gate Bridge]
results.creator_credit: David Morgan, John Richardson and Kestrel Films (Australia)
results.brief_description: Melbourne’s West Gate Bridge is a gateway to the future - a future of unprecedented residential, commercial and industrial growth for Melbourne and its Western regions. This film of the opening ceremony gives a historical outlook to the development of the river, shipping and the effects on the growth of the city of Melbourne.

results.title: Gateway to a city
results.creator_credit: Roderick Johnston and Roderick Films International
results.brief_description: A brief history of the area near Circular Quay, Sydney, known as The Rocks. Shows how this valuable site has become a neglected backwater and indicates, by the use of models, how it will look in the near future after redevelopment.
